newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines signs repo deal with Bank of Japan.
newsitem.headline: Philippines signs repo deal with Bank of Japan.

text.p: Philippine Central Bank governor Gabriel Singson said on Thursday the bank had signed a dollar repurchase agreement with the Bank of Japan.

"The (Central Bank), in a move to promote monetary cooperation among the region's central banks and further bolster their capability to ward off currency speculation, has signed a repurchase agreement with Bank of Japan," Singson said in a statement.
The deal was the sixth Manila has signed with other central banks in the region. The agreements now total $3.5 billion.
The Philippine Central Bank recently signed similar deals with monetary authorities of Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand and Indonesia.

The agreements allow the Central Bank to borrow U.S. dollars from other central banks using its U.S. Treasury bills and notes as collaterals, with a proviso that it will buy back the U.S. government securities at a later date.

"Formulated in the aftermath of the Mexican crisis that triggered currency speculation in the emerging markets worldwide, the agreements in effect provides a multibillion-dollar quick disbursing facility to the region's central banks," Singson said.
Singson said the bank was finalising details of a similar agreement with another Asian central bank, which he declined to name. - Manila newsroom 63 2 8418938 Fax 8176267
